resources.string: Couldn\'t switch grayscale mode, it\'s still %s
Can\'t run without a granted permission
Grayscale Switcher doesn\'t have a permission to write secure settings, in particular we need option \"Developer options -> Simulate color space\"
You can give this permission in two ways:\n— unlock ROOT rights or\n— set up ADB tool on your PC, connect via USB and execute the next command in PC console (scrollable):
adb shell pm grant com.laralex.grayswitcher android.permission.WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS
If you\'re worried of giving such permission to us, check out our open source code, which proofs, that we DON\'T do any stuff on your phone except for switching of the grayscale setting.
